newsitem.title: USA: Computer Sciences gets federal contract.
newsitem.headline: Computer Sciences gets federal contract.

text.p: Computer Sciences Corp said Wednesday it has been awarded a contract by a federal agency with a potential value of $287 million over eight years.
The base-year of the contract is worth $14.5 million. If all options are exercised during the eight-year contract period, the full value would be $287 million, the company said.
Under the contract, it will provide specialized technical assistance to the U.S. Commerce Department's patent and trademark office.
